terms.definition: Interest calculated on the initial principal and also on the accumulated interest of previous periods.
The practice of spreading investments among different financial instruments to reduce risk.
A type of investment fund that holds multiple assets and trades on stock exchanges.
A performance measure used to evaluate the efficiency of an investment.
A numerical expression representing an individual's creditworthiness.
A reserve of money set aside to cover unexpected expenses or financial emergencies.
The value of all assets minus the total of all liabilities.
The net amount of cash moving in and out of a business.
Earnings Before Interest, Taxes, Depreciation, and Amortization - a measure of company profitability.
The total market value of a company's outstanding shares.
A decentralized digital ledger that records transactions across many computers.
Financial services without central intermediaries, using smart contracts on blockchains.
A unique digital asset that represents ownership of a specific item or content.
